text: I have some updates from Autodesk w/ regards to PMMC.
It looks like they’re getting close to settling in on a building in the central eastside, one that wouldn’t be the Shleifer building, as their PDX headquarters.
That building would give them 5-6 floors of space that would become available (ideally) starting in August and be done by sometime in Feb 2018.
They have some capacity for some heavy equipment, so conceivably if PMMC were to become a thing, we would be able to have access to it.
For a number of legal and accounting reasons, their ability to buy us a bunch of machines might not be in play.
But for similar reasons their ability to give us money to operate independently might be in play.
As you may have seen, the Autodesk CEO resigned recently.
Replacing him in the interim are two Autodesk VPs, one of them being Amar Hanspal, the guy who came to our office way back when and is a huge fan of this concept.
It looks like we may be able to get some funding in the short term for PMMC from a couple groups within Autodesk, including their $500m Forge Fund.
Something Kevin and his boss are asking us - could we get PMMC started in March as part of CENTRL Office and we figure out the building and equipment aspects in parallel?

Given that Rick T is officially done w/ PIE, this might be a way for us to lock in Rick on PMMC while helping us build both the startup and mentorship community for PMMC. And as part of that we might get some desktop prototyping equipment (Formlabs, cough, cough, Formlabs).
And as part of that we’d need to cover branding, collateral, and website design for PMMC.

His ask is for us to put together a budget against that, which we can work on next weeks. And hopefully in 4-6 weeks, we can have an opportunity to kick off PMMC in a trial fashion out of a coworking space.
Incubate the incubater
Thank you for sharing. Going to marinate on this.
it’s exciting

almost. it feels real.
and some of this can be parlayed into the PDC conversations we’re having. That’s on a July timeframe, but the RFP would be due in March.
What's the scope of the offerings out of the coworking space?
Mentorship + product design strategy / guidance + some proto
